hints.content:
**Area** is the space a flat shape fills.

To measure area, we can count the number of **same-sized** square units needed to cover a shape. The squares should have **no gaps or overlaps**.

![A square.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/913132d526938cf267deaa69928edc2351e20d30) is $1$ **square unit** because it measures $1$ unit on each side.

This shape has $12$ square units covering it, but there are gaps:

![A rectangle made up of three rows with equal-sized squares. Each row has four squares and four missing rectangles.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/dd921615637cbc3863b1c32159712e449baecff2)

This shape has $12$ square units covering it, but there are gaps and overlaps:

![This shape is a square with a smaller missing square in the lower left corner. Twelve squares that are the same size as the missing square are overlapping and partially cover the shape leaving several gaps.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/4b89661656954700efd23d1122d50c284848dbd4)

This shape has $12$ square units covering it. There are no gaps or overlaps.

![A rectangle made up of four rows of equal-sized squares. Each row has 3 squares.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/1492c1549f8175f29b9a5e640381591267c75844)

So, this shape has an area of $12$ square units.

This shape has $12$ square units covering it. There are no gaps or overlaps.

![A rectangle made up of two rows of equal-sized squares. Each row has six squares.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/95e5bd74ab5bd9fe72432d840281f557bd1ff8fa)

So, this shape has an area of $12$ square units.

These shapes have an area of $12$ square units:

![A rectangle made up of four rows of equal-sized squares. Each row has 3 squares.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/1492c1549f8175f29b9a5e640381591267c75844) ![A rectangle made up of two rows of equal-sized squares. Each row has six squares.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/95e5bd74ab5bd9fe72432d840281f557bd1ff8fa)

question.content:
**Which shapes have an area of $12$ square units?**

![A square.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/913132d526938cf267deaa69928edc2351e20d30) is $1$ square unit.

![A rectangle made up of three rows with equal-sized squares. Each row has four squares and four missing rectangles.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/dd921615637cbc3863b1c32159712e449baecff2)
![A rectangle made up of two rows of equal-sized squares. Each row has six squares.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/95e5bd74ab5bd9fe72432d840281f557bd1ff8fa)

![This shape is a square with a smaller missing square in the lower left corner. Twelve squares that are the same size as the missing square are overlapping and partially cover the shape leaving several gaps.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/4b89661656954700efd23d1122d50c284848dbd4)
